title: Mine several blocks in a single call
body: Many users have asked about the possibility of mining multiple blocks in a single call. Right now the only way to do this is to call `evm_mine` in a loop, but this isn't very performant.

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done

Thanks for your interest in improving Hardhat, and for funding this feature @bartjman.

Unfortunately, we can't merge a PR on this just yet, as we are doing some significant changes to Hardhat Network at the moment, that will radically change how new blocks are mined. To avoid this situation in the future, I'd recommend commenting in the issue first, letting us know that you are willing to put a bounty on it.

Also, I believe the reason for this feature request is to make this RPC call instant/almost instant, and the approach of iterating mining new blocks falls short on that front. Something far more involved is needed to make this performant, possibly changing our blockchain's architecture, keeping gaps between blocks.
@alcuadrado thanks for the update, I'll close my PR till the architecture is ready :)

I was asking myself if `ethereumjs-vm` should be modified in order to add a new `_mineMultipleAction` that do something shown below:

1. Uses a multi-threaded or GPU approach
2. Skip the mining and verification of the inner blocks

Should that be the approach?

I think any solution that tries to actually mine the blocks probably won't work. In our case, we need to mine about 100.000 blocks and a delay of about 1 second would be fine. But this is currently off by several orders of magnitude, so you would have to dramatically improve mining speed and a lower level somewhere.

But that would still not solve this issue for users who run simulations that cover months or years, such as vesting schedules, minting curves, etc.

I think one solution would be to simply increase the block number by 100.000. so we would go from block 12 to block 100.012. And the blocks in between simply don't exist. This would break some things, but for testing, this would be gold. So as long as the documentation clearly states that this helper function breaks some functionality, it would be great for testing over larger block ranges.

Thank you very much for your explanation @bartjman, now the route to overcome this issue is fairly more clear, as mining that number of blocks would not be correct it could be set, as specified before (at the second point of my post), that the first 99.999 blocks do not need to be mined, only the last one. In this way this would work for simulation.

I've been digging a bit deeper on this, and I think a nice compromise would be to mine blocks with a block reward of 0 when this method is used. This way, if there are no pending txs, the state root shouldn't change (⚠️ this should be confirmed ⚠️), so there's no need to run them in the VM, but just create them and add them to the blockchain data structure. This should be almost instant.

As I mentioned before, #1087 changes how new blocks are created, so I'd rather wait for it to land. It adds a bit of complexity to this "mining empty blocks" thing.

Finally, if creating 100s of empty blocks is also slow, we may be able to modify the `Blockchain` so that it can have "gaps" and create the missing blocks on demand.

@alcuadrado If that is the case then the `mineEmptyBlock` could be rewritten as `mineEmptyBlocks`, where an optional parameter `n` could be appended. I could not profile the application in a serious way, just using `process.hrtime` calls, are you using any profiler for getting the timing results for each function? Something like flamegraphs (https://clinicjs.org/documentation/flame/04-flamegraphs/)?

https://github.com/nomiclabs/hardhat/blob/2aecc0e3b64250fffa220aec62f1a9aa86eef296/packages/hardhat-core/src/internal/hardhat-network/provider/node.ts#L333-L386

Hi all, I'm interested too in this issue for testing. Since #1087 landed in February, is there any update on the agreed way forward? I may have some spare cycles to lend.

Thanks!

Hey @thundo, 

You can find a spec of how this should work [here](https://www.notion.so/nomiclabs/Mining-multiple-blocks-edad145bbce94d958d778b134588f9d6).

Let us know if you want to implement it. We'd gladly help answer any question about it.

Thanks for the quick response @alcuadrado. The spec is very detailed (nice!). 

I'll have a look in the coming days to see if I'm up to the task. 👍
Very interested in seeing this ticket progress! And wondering if there has been any progress for this ticket :)
Hi @asafsilman. This is really high on our priority list, but sadly there are some more pressing things we are working on (especially adding support for the London hardfork).

Yes, actively, see #2032

Hi everyone, and thanks for the patience!

[Hardhat v2.9.0](https://github.com/NomicFoundation/hardhat/releases/tag/hardhat%402.9.0) added a new method, `hardhat_mine`, that lets you mine multiple blocks in a single call. Read [the docs](https://hardhat.org/hardhat-network/reference/#hardhat-mine) to learn more, but the tl;dr is that you can now do this:

```js
// mine 256 blocks
await hre.network.provider.send("hardhat_mine", ["0x100"]);
```

I hope you find it useful, and please let us know if you find any issues around this feature.
Great! I owe you 0.5 ETH for this... let me know where to send it.

@boringcrypto no need to pay at all, this has been on our roadmap for a while! But if you're feeling generous, you can always contribute to [Hardhat's Gitcoin grant](https://gitcoin.co/grants/1592/hardhat-by-nomic-labs) :slightly_smiling_face:
